data.title: Hatha yoga TTC
data.description:
[{"title":"Overview","description":"

A comprehensive program designed for individuals who have a passion for yoga and aspire to become certified yoga instructors. Whether you're a dedicated practitioner seeking to deepen your understanding or someone interested in sharing the transformative power of yoga with others, our Yoga TTC provides you with the knowledge, skills, and certification necessary to teach yoga classes.

 

"},{"title":"About the Course","institution":"","description":"

Our course, meticulously crafted by an expert panel with years of immersion in yoga, covers both the practical and theoretical aspects of yoga in the Level 1 TTC Program. From chanting and Surya Namaskaras to Asanas, Pranayama, Mudras, and Bandhas, you'll embark on a holistic journey to deepen your practice and teaching abilities.


 


 

"},{"title":"Course Overview visit www.nirakulayoga.com","institution":"","description":"

Nirakula’s course is set by an expert panel who have immersed themselves in Yoga for years. We cover both the Practical and Theoretical aspects of Yoga in the Level 1 TTC Program. We begin with learning to chant and then move onto Surya Namaskaras, Asanas and Pranayama. Also included are Mudras and Bandhas. 


 

"},{"title":"Course Contents","institution":"","description":"

Practicals Module

 

Surya Namaskar (Sun Salutations): You will explore and practice 3 types of Surya Namaskars.
 

Asanas (Yoga Poses): You will learn and practice over 70 yoga asanas, including detailed instruction on breath synchronization, gazing points, key alignment principles, contraindications, benefits, entering and exiting each pose, as well as modifications and variations to accommodate different body types and abilities.
 

Pranayama (Breathing Techniques): The course will introduce you to five pranayama techniques, including Nadi Shodhana (Alternate Nostril Breathing), Seetali (Cooling Breath), Sheetkari (Hissing Breath), Bhramari (Bee Breath), and Ujjayi (Victorious Breath). These practices help regulate the breath, calm the mind, and cultivate prana (life force energy).
 

Mudras and Bandhas: You will explore the use of hand gestures known as mudras and energy locks called bandhas.
 

Pratyahara (Withdrawal of Senses): The course will guide you through practices to cultivate pratyahara. Through specific techniques, you will learn to turn your focus inward, promoting inner stillness and concentration.
 

Dharana (Concentration) and Dhyana (Meditation): You will engage in exercises to develop concentration (dharana) and meditation (dhyana) skills. These practices aim to quiet the mind, deepen self-awareness, and cultivate a state of calm and clarity.
 

Kriyas (Purification Techniques): The course includes 2 kriyas, namely Jala Neti (nasal cleansing using water) and Sutra Neti (nasal cleansing using a special thread). These practices help purify the nasal passages, enhance respiratory health, and prepare the body for pranayama and meditation practices.

 

Theory Module

 

Introduction to Yoga

History of Yoga

Definitions of yoga

Four paths of yoga

Hatha yoga theory

Koshas, Pranas and Gunas

Chakras and Nadis

Philosophy - Sankhya

Anatomy - 6 systems

Universal prayers

Patanjali Yoga Sutras - Chapters 1 & 2

Basic Samskrita

 

Teaching Practice

 

Asana with props

Hatha Vinyasa

Hands-on adjustments

Teaching methodology

Yoga Nidra

"}]

data.title: Meditations from the Tantras
data.description:
[{"title":"Overview","description":"

In this course we will be exploring the following topics:

MEDITATION BASICS – How to sit comfortably & still, how to begin meditating, how to focus the wandering mind, dealing with pain, how to go deeper into your present meditation practice, connect with your Higher Consciousness.

YOGA NIDRA – (Psychic Sleep Meditation) - the hallmark of Satyananda Bihar School of Yoga and the most popular and enjoyable meditation. It is a lying down relaxation meditation which systematically takes you from the world of outer sounds step by step through body, breath and mind to your deep subconscious to release negativity, tap into creativity and positivity and explore your deeper consciousness connecting to your Higher Consciousness. 

AJAPA JAPA  –  Meditation on the breath with universal or personal mantra, to calm, focus & purify the mind, taking it deeper and connecting with the rhythms of nature and with your Higher Consciousness. The breath is a constant companion and faithful friend.

ANTAR MOUNA MEDITATION – Witness your senses, your thoughts & emotions thus being able to stand back and control the mind by putting on to positivity and transcend it to experience and rest in that deepest inner, silent, empty space of energy & consciousness, the Antar Mouna.

CHIDAKASH DHARANA - ART MEDITATION – Exploring & experiencing the inner mind screen of our consciousness and actualizing it thru artistic expression.

TRATAK – If you can’t keep your eyes closed, open them to gaze at a candle flame, sunrise/sunset etc to focus, purify and energizes and connect to the Cosmic Consciousness through seeing and breathing. Good for restless minds, childrens’ concentration, good sleep, psychic development and artistic minds.

CHAKRA SHUDDHI – Purify, balance and energize your chakras (energy centres) through breathing, visualization and mantra. A complete practice which also prepares for Kriya Yoga and safe Kundalini awakening.

MANTRA MEDITATIONS – Experiencing Mantra chanting as Vaikhari (aloud) Manasic (mentally), and Upanshu (silently) through Likhit Jap (writing and drawing mantras), Chankramanam (walking) and finding the best way to benefit from mantras & their associated Yantras (geometric shapes of power). 

"},{"title":"Course Fees","institution":"","description":"

Fees: 7500 INR for 1 Week

Each extra week: 5000 INR / week

Whole 4 weeks course: 20000 INR

Stay and food at the Ashram will be charged separately at about 2000 INR/day.

 

"},{"title":"Course Timing","institution":"","description":"

There will be 2 sessions everyday for all the 4 weeks. The sessions will be at 11am and 230pm.

data.style: Satyananda Yoga / Bihar School of Yoga, Hatha Yoga, Meditation

teacher.description: Swami Yogaratna Saraswati was trained as a sannyasin disciple of the Bihar School of Yoga, which was founded by Swami Satyananda Saraswati, direct disciple of Swami Sivananda of Rishikesh. With over 38 years experience in yoga and meditation, Swami Yogaratna has given yoga programs all over India and overseas. She is particularly appreciated for her talent in leading Yoga Nidra (psychic sleep) and other Meditations from the Tantras, yoga therapy, yoga for children, the higher techniques of Chakra Sadhana, Kundalini Yoga and many others including satsangs (talks) and kirtan (group singing).

teacher.school_description: We are a beautiful heritage home, ashram, spiritual retreat center, yoga and meditation school on 2 ½ acres of coconut grove and rice paddy organic farm. We are located on the West coast of India, near the ancient sea side pilgrimage town of Gokarna 135kms South of Goa, in the village of Bankikodla. We seek to preserve the heritage of the local area and give back to the local community, through seva (voluntary work) to aid in our own spiritual growth. Come be a part of the Shankar Prasad family and enjoy the experience of living in a spiritual community!

data.title: Everyday morning yoga for weight loss
data.description:
[{"title":"Himas yoga - for weight loss","description":"

I am a knowledgeable yoga teacher dedicated to helping you find balance and inner peace. My classes focus on alignment, mindfulness, and relaxation, guiding you through asanas and breathing exercises to improve flexibility and reduce stress. Whether you're a beginner or experienced yogi, I adapt to your needs and encourage self-discovery on your yoga journey.

 

Certainly! My yoga classes are designed to cater to a wide range of students, from beginners to intermediate practitioners. Here are some key features of my classes:

Inclusive Approach: I create a welcoming and inclusive environment where everyone feels comfortable regardless of their level of experience or physical abilities.

Alignment and Safety: I prioritize proper alignment in each pose to ensure safety and prevent injuries. I provide clear cues and adjustments to help students find the right alignment for their bodies.

Mindfulness and Breathwork: I emphasize the importance of mindfulness and breathwork throughout the practice. We focus on deep, controlled breathing to enhance relaxation and mind-body connection.

Variety of Styles: I offer a variety of yoga styles, including Hatha, Vinyasa, and Yin, to cater to different preferences and goals. This allows students to explore and find what resonates with them.

Progressive Sequences: My classes often follow a progressive sequence, building on poses and techniques from one session to the next. This helps students develop their practice over time.

Stress Reduction: I incorporate relaxation techniques and meditation to help students reduce stress, improve mental clarity, and cultivate a sense of inner calm.

Personalization: I encourage students to listen to their bodies and make modifications as needed. I also provide options for both beginners and more advanced students, allowing everyone to challenge themselves at their own pace.

Community and Support: I foster a sense of community within the class, where students can connect and support each other on their yoga journeys.

Online Availability: My classes are available both in-person and online, making it convenient for students to join from the comfort of their homes or attend a local studio.

Overall, my goal as a yoga teacher is to help students develop a holistic yoga practice that enhances physical well-being, mental clarity, and spiritual growth, all while fostering a sense of community and self-discovery.

With a passion for nutrition and a deep understanding of the science behind it, Hima is here to provide you with expert guidance tailored to your specific circumstances. Whether you're looking to manage your weight, optimize your athletic performance, address specific dietary restrictions, or simply adopt a more balanced and nourishing diet, Hima has the knowledge and expertise to help you achieve your objectives.

Your journey towards improved health and vitality starts with a conversation with Hima. Together, you'll explore your dietary preferences, lifestyle, and health goals to create a personalized nutrition plan that fits seamlessly into your life. Hima is not just a source of information; they are your partner in making sustainable and effective changes to your eating habits.

With Hima as your Nutritional Advisor, you can look forward to evidence-based recommendations, ongoing support, and a holistic approach to nutrition that goes beyond counting calories. Get ready to embark on a transformative journey towards better health and well-being under the guidance of Hima, your trusted nutritional advisor.

"}]

data.title: Therapeutic Yoga
data.description:
[{"title":"Yoga for health and healing ","description":"

Class Descriptions

Therapeutic Yoga

A yogic therapy-based class is a great class for those injured or rehabilitating and facing health related issues. The disorders and diseases related to Diabetes, Hypertension, digestive, metabolic, respiratory, gynaecological, neuro-muscular skeletal, spinal, spondylitis, back pains, knee pains, joint pains, thyroid, excretory related, kidney, migraine, insomnia,  stress, eye sight improvement, stamina, Adrenal balancing, Anger, Concentration, Ego and Greed, I.Q. etc are managed through the by-product benefit of the tradition knowledge of Yoga and other alternative means of Healing. This session needs patience and surrender to let the healing flow.

Dynamic Yoga
Strong, dynamic workshop style class with arm balances, inversions, backbends & twists. Be prepared to keep a brisk pace and explore poses we don’t normally get to experience in a general class. Dynamic sequencing combines breath and movement to build strength, flexibility, endurance, concentration and compassionate approach to flow with the breath through sun salutations, standing, sitting, supine, prone and inverted postures. Centre progressively allows newer and more advanced participants the opportunity to go deeper to relax, honouring the body as needed. This is a great session to work on extra fats and weight management. Everyone is welcome. 
 

Children Yoga

Introducing children to yoga helps them learn healthy lifestyle habits and set the foundation for a responsible and happy future. We use chanting, balancing, memory games, moral role plays and gazing practices to improve their memory, concentration and focus. We motivate them to express their aptitude, skills and raise their self-worth as well as boost their confidence. Through dramatization and role play kids express their emotions better. Relaxed learning deepens the perception, reducing distractions and increasing attention span. This activates the dormant areas of the brain. Children are born yogis, lets preserve their yoginnocence.

Sukshma Yoga

A practice that uses slow movement, props and longer holds to stimulate and release body toxins. The nature of this practice is meditative, asking us to slow down, turn in and shift from doing to being. This session is the session meant for longevity, purification and release of all the unwanted stress. This opens up the blocked pathways inside our body and joints. It’s a releasing factor to our suppressed subtle energies. This practice is applicable to everyone from childhood, adulthood, motherhood, fatherhood, parenthood, homemakers/ housewives, grand parenthood. This clears out the extras so that we naturally be the best of ourselves.

Pratyahara

A bridge that has a strong connectivity of two destinations is pratyahara, these innovative sessions are made to make one reach the potential destination through the applied knowledge of our scriptures. Internal journeys through each of the ‘dwara’ and de-knotting the knots or ‘granthis’ inside is the key essence of this session. This session induces towards dharana, dhyana and samadhi if perceived with utmost sincerity and reverence.

"}]

data.description:
[{"title":"Hatha yoga","description":"

Welcome to our yoga class, where we embark on a holistic journey towards well-being and self-discovery. Our sessions are designed to cater to individuals of all levels, from beginners to those seeking intermediate challenges.

Here's what you can expect:

1. Suryanamaskara and Sukshma Vyayama:

We commence our practice with energizing Sun/Moon Salutations and diverse styles of Sukshma Vyayama each day. Sukshma Vyayama involves subtle warm-up exercises to prepare your body for the upcoming session.


2. Asanas:

Progress from beginner to intermediate-level asanas, including Vinyasa flows.
Concentrated stretches precede specific asanas, ensuring enhanced comfort and noticeable improvements within the same session.

3. Pranayama:

Learn pranayama techniques tailored for addressing various breathing problems and promoting overall well-being.
Dedicated sessions focusing on pranayama for half an hour on specific days.

4. Meditation and Deep Relaxation:

Experience the profound benefits of meditation, with extended sessions on designated days.
The class concludes with deep relaxation or meditation for a peaceful state of mind.


5. Student Engagement:

Students are encouraged to pay close attention to their practice, fostering mindfulness and self-awareness.
Instructors provide personalized adjustments to enhance the effectiveness of each pose.


6. Varied Sequences:

Every day brings a fresh and unique sequence to keep the practice engaging and diverse.


7. Outcome:

  • Results vary individually and depend on dedication.
  • Expect improvements in body flexibility, enhanced calmness, heightened concentration, and potential reversal of health issues through the activation of acupressure points.
  • Our instructors also offer suggestions for maintaining a healthy lifestyle.
  • In our yoga class, we believe that dedication is key to unlocking the full spectrum of benefits.
  • Join us on this transformative journey towards a healthier and more balanced life.
"}]

data.title: Everyday morning yoga for weight loss
data.description:
[{"title":"Himas yoga - for weight loss","description":"

I am a knowledgeable yoga teacher dedicated to helping you find balance and inner peace. My classes focus on alignment, mindfulness, and relaxation, guiding you through asanas and breathing exercises to improve flexibility and reduce stress. Whether you're a beginner or experienced yogi, I adapt to your needs and encourage self-discovery on your yoga journey.

 

Certainly! My yoga classes are designed to cater to a wide range of students, from beginners to intermediate practitioners. Here are some key features of my classes:

Inclusive Approach: I create a welcoming and inclusive environment where everyone feels comfortable regardless of their level of experience or physical abilities.

Alignment and Safety: I prioritize proper alignment in each pose to ensure safety and prevent injuries. I provide clear cues and adjustments to help students find the right alignment for their bodies.

Mindfulness and Breathwork: I emphasize the importance of mindfulness and breathwork throughout the practice. We focus on deep, controlled breathing to enhance relaxation and mind-body connection.

Variety of Styles: I offer a variety of yoga styles, including Hatha, Vinyasa, and Yin, to cater to different preferences and goals. This allows students to explore and find what resonates with them.

Progressive Sequences: My classes often follow a progressive sequence, building on poses and techniques from one session to the next. This helps students develop their practice over time.

Stress Reduction: I incorporate relaxation techniques and meditation to help students reduce stress, improve mental clarity, and cultivate a sense of inner calm.

Personalization: I encourage students to listen to their bodies and make modifications as needed. I also provide options for both beginners and more advanced students, allowing everyone to challenge themselves at their own pace.

Community and Support: I foster a sense of community within the class, where students can connect and support each other on their yoga journeys.

Online Availability: My classes are available both in-person and online, making it convenient for students to join from the comfort of their homes or attend a local studio.

Overall, my goal as a yoga teacher is to help students develop a holistic yoga practice that enhances physical well-being, mental clarity, and spiritual growth, all while fostering a sense of community and self-discovery.

"},{"title":"Personalized Nutritional Advisor: Your Path to a Healthier You","institution":"","description":"

Welcome to the world of personalized wellness and nutrition! Meet Hima, your dedicated Nutritional Advisor on a mission to guide you towards a healthier and happier life. In an age where information about nutrition is abundant but often overwhelming, Hima is your trusted ally in making informed choices that suit your unique needs and goals.

With a passion for nutrition and a deep understanding of the science behind it, Hima is here to provide you with expert guidance tailored to your specific circumstances. Whether you're looking to manage your weight, optimize your athletic performance, address specific dietary restrictions, or simply adopt a more balanced and nourishing diet, Hima has the knowledge and expertise to help you achieve your objectives.

Your journey towards improved health and vitality starts with a conversation with Hima. Together, you'll explore your dietary preferences, lifestyle, and health goals to create a personalized nutrition plan that fits seamlessly into your life. Hima is not just a source of information; they are your partner in making sustainable and effective changes to your eating habits.

With Hima as your Nutritional Advisor, you can look forward to evidence-based recommendations, ongoing support, and a holistic approach to nutrition that goes beyond counting calories. Get ready to embark on a transformative journey towards better health and well-being under the guidance of Hima, your trusted nutritional advisor.

"}]

data.title: Yoga for All @ 6AM
data.description:
[{"title":"Yoga for All @ 6AM","description":"

This class is helpful in improving the well being of our body, mind and soul. As we focus on each aspect everyday.

This course is suitable for those who want to learn about yoga from the scratch and also for those who are daily practitioners and want to improve and continue their yoga journey effectively. 

We conduct five classes a week and each class would be one hour long. 

We start the session with prayer and gratitude practice everyday to create the positive aura around us and feel more positive and connected. 

Warm up comes up next as it is important to do it prior to any other asana so that we can relax and ease our joints.

Sun salutation is included in our routine session as this helps to keep us flexible and more healthy. 

Everyday we practice a combination of asanas working on different areas of our body. Asanas help us to stay in shape and feel more strong. 

Relaxation is essential part of the session as it helps to relieve any muscle tension and let our body and mind absorb all the benefits of whole practice. 

Pranayam is equally important and added to our daily sessions so that we can breathe more and improve our inner health as well. 

Meditation and hastha mudra practice are also included in our wholesome health package to balance our mental health and make us feel more connected with our inner self. 

Sound meditation, acupressure, tips about diet and daily routine are some extra knowledge we share with our students every now and then. 

Teacher will pay attention to each and every student, helping them to correct their posture and resolve their query in the same session. 

 

Outcomes of the course : This yoga journey helps you to improve physical, inner and mental health. Daily practice makes you more flexible, energetic and keeps your body healthy and your  mind peaceful.

"}]

data.title: Embodied & Functional Yoga
data.description:
[{"title":"Simplifying Yoga For The Modern Busy & Demanding Lifestyle ","description":"

Discover how you can unlock authentic whole-body movement from the inside out, based on awareness, not angles.

 

An Embodied Yoga practice places its focus first on awareness itself, teaching that how we move is more important than how far we move. Embodied Yoga works with our bodies in their most natural way. There is so much more that can be said, but until you’ve experienced Embodied Yoga :)

 

I'm here to normalize yoga and make it accessible to everyone regardless of shape, size, age, and location. I love to work with beginners, especially on pain management to improve their overall quality of life. 

"},{"title":"","institution":""}]

teacher.description:
I don't believe in styles of yoga, for me, YOGA is one! Focusing on a truly holistic approach to our whole system of body, mind, and soul. I enjoy inspiring others to improve their state of wellness and to commit themselves to long-term health and well-being.


As a freelance traveling teacher, I lead Yoga / Movement classes, workshops, and retreats in India, Sri Lanka, and in Europe. I love to delve into yoga & movement as a way of life.  My approach allows you to get in touch with your own body (the vehicle for the inner journey) which you lost the connection to, in the modern busy, and demanding life.

data.title: Yoga for weight loss
data.description:
[{"title":"","description":"

Monthly Yoga Course by SAM Yoga Labs

Overview of the Course:

Welcome to SAM Yoga labs, a transformative monthly yoga journey designed to bring back the lost you. Throughout this program, we will delve into the essence of Hatha & Ashtanga Yoga, empowering participants to delve deep into their conscience. Whether you are a beginner seeking a holistic introduction to yoga or an experienced practitioner looking to deepen your practice, this course offers a balanced and enriching experience.

Who is This Course For?

Ideal for Beginners: Perfect for those new to yoga, providing a solid foundation and understanding of fundamental practices.

Intermediate Practitioners: Suitable for individuals with some yoga experience, offering opportunities to refine techniques and deepen awareness.

Advanced Students: Tailored to challenge and expand the practice of seasoned yogis, exploring advanced postures and nuanced aspects of yoga.

Typical Class Plan:

Opening and Centering (10 minutes): Begin each session with centering techniques and mindfulness practices.

Warm-Up and Breathwork (10 minutes): Energize the body with dynamic movements and pranayama exercises.

Main Practice (25 minutes): Explore a variety of yoga poses, sequences, and themes, adapting to different levels of expertise.

Cool-Down and Relaxation (10 minutes): Wind down with gentle stretches, restorative poses, and guided relaxation.

Closing Reflection (5 minutes): Share insights, ask questions, and set intentions for personal practice.

What are the Course Outcomes?

Upon completion of a month session with SAM Yoga Labs, participants can expect to:

Cultivate Flexibility: Enhance physical flexibility and mobility through a well-rounded yoga practice.

Stress Reduction: Develop mindfulness and relaxation skills to manage stress and foster a calm mind.

Strength and Balance: Build core strength, improve balance, and promote overall physical well-being.

Mind-Body Connection: Deepen the connection between mind and body, fostering a holistic approach to health.

Join us on this transformative journey of self-discovery and well-being. Whether you're stepping onto the mat for the first time or seeking to elevate your practice, SAM Yoga Labs' monthly course is designed to inspire and guide you.

"}]

Hari Om. We will be learning traditional hatha yoga in this course. In a typical yoga session, we will be doing chanting, asana, pranayama and meditation. We will be following the tradition of Swami Sivananda and Bihar School of Yoga.

 

The aim of the yoga program will be:

- Overcoming physical blocks and develop physical resilience and well being

- Balance, expansion and upliftment of prana, vital energy.

- Develop ability to recognize thoughts and emotions and consciously channel them towards the positive.

 

The yoga practices will be doable by everyone with progression happening in the practices through the month.

 

The classes will also happen offline at Yoga in the Garden (or Roof) in HSR Layout, Bangalore. You are welcome to join on some days atleast if you are close by.

 

Look forward to do yoga together. 

 

Hari Om Tat Sat.

"}]

teacher.description: I teach yoga in the tradition of Swami Sivananda and Bihar School of Yoga. Look forward to spreading the traditional Hatha Yoga as taught by my masters in the guru-shishya parampara.

teacher.description: I am an internationally certified Yoga Trainer. I have completed my RYT 500 hours from US yoga alliance . Expertised in Hatha Yoga, Vinyasa, Power Yoga, HIIT , aerobics Pranayama, and Meditation. Yoga has been part of my life since childhood . Now, being a regular practitioner of traditional yoga from past 5 years, committed for providing extensive instructions and counseling my clients, while motivating them to find true inner peace and their healthiest self. This journey has helped me grow stronger, more flexible and calmer personally. Yoga inspires me to live each moment more mindfully. In my classes, love to combine creative sequencing, variation in Surya namaskar , HIIT, aerobics, prop workout and a dose of inspiration to help you deepen your practice. I seek to help others live by nurturing body, mind and soul with yoga. I'm conducting online classes from Monday to Friday.

data.title: Hatha yoga -embodied morning flow
data.description:
[{"title":" Hatha yoga - embodied morning flow","description":"

Lesson will follow  the traditional structure with chanting, asana,pranayama and a short meditation/yoga nidra, integrated by the principle of embodiment.

The classes are based on the Hatha yoga tradition with an integrated approach that combines teaching from different schools (mainly Sivananda, Satyananda, Iyengar), but,through the concept of embodying the practice and explore ourselves. This change is due to my personal history as a teacher and as a student: after having thought and practiced follwing this traditional methods, I have got to know their limits (in a physical sense through injuries,in a mental sense through the inabilty to really come to my needs).  Therefore these classes will quite likely move away from what you might have experienced in other yoga classes, as we come into a more free and empathetic way to work with the body. I will combine somatic movements, restorative poses and the practice will be  structured on the base of my background studies in the field of psychology and yoga massage. This will ensure that your practice won't be structured in a rigid way, but you will be  really coming closer to yourself,your body and its needs. You will be able to freely move  in a safe and mindful way. A general structure will include the warming up of the joints, gentle and more complex movements where we will be able to reach poses grounding into them, and finding movements again into that stillness. Keeping your mind alert on what's happening inside, you will be asked to experience and feel how every asana and transition affects your body and what you should avoid doing, acknowledging so, the unique features of your body.
More focus and self-awareness, an increased level on physical and mental energy, a  state of self confidence and trust and a feeling of balance and overall strength will be experienced and will guide you through the rest of the day.
 

"}]

As a traveller, grown up in the west, and passionate about east culture, I will guide you into your journey, combining all the beatiful knowledge I gain from all the countries and the teachers I met.
My personal experience, my studies in psychology and yoga massage; my passion for free and therapeutical movement, and a very deep connection with wild nature, will be melt into the scientific study of our own body and mind.
The class will be inspired by the Bihar school of yoga, and by the embodied practices with gentle and energizing morning yoga sessions

teacher.description:
Ruta's journey as a shloka teacher began with a deep passion for preserving and passing on the rich cultural heritage of India. Her dedication to this art form is evident in her comprehensive knowledge of Sanskrit, impeccable pronunciation, and a deep understanding of the meanings and nuances of the shlokas. Her teaching methodology is known for its meticulous attention to detail and her ability to make the often complex and archaic language accessible to learners of all levels.

Ruta has made significant contributions to the preservation and promotion of India's spiritual and literary traditions. She has conducted numerous workshops, seminars, and online classes, attracting students and enthusiasts from across the globe. Her warm and engaging teaching style, combined with her vast knowledge, has made her a sought-after guru for those looking to delve into the world of shlokas.

The advanced asana workshop is open for yoga teachers and practitioners of all levels, who are willing to up skill and explore deeper aspects of asanas.

The workshop deals with advanced postures (Asanas), sequences (vinyasa flows), mobility and strength which consists of inversion, arm balance, leg balance, hip opener and backbend asana series with proper breathing and alignment, guided from expertise.
What are the key learnings?
Mastering the technique to attain a challenging asana by breaking down the relevant key actions.
Gaining insights on the foundational movements in order to access the final posture.
Achieving additional strength and understanding to progress personal practice.
Mastery over body - mastery over mind and emotions.

data.title: Yoga for Health Conditions - Rheumatoid Arthritis, Diabetes, Hypertension
data.description:
[{"title":"Overview","description":"

This yoga class will be focused on Rheumatoid Arthritis (RA). RA is an auto immune disorder which affects about 2% of the population and is due to a vata imbalance in the body. I have the condition and it is chronic. RA is quite painful. Yoga has really helped me. Hence spreading the benefits. I almost have no pain now, once in a while, in some joints, yes. 

 

We will do specific asanas - the Pawanmuktasana series targeting the joints. This sequence was conceived by Swami Satyananda of the Bihar School of Yoga and Sivananda tradition. This will increase the flow of prana - vital energy - to the joints. Outcomes will be to improve mobility of joints, ease stiffness and help alleviate pain. 

 

Ideally these practices should be done at the beginning of everyday by all people affected by RA. We are doing a 11am batch because if you are suffering from intense Rheumatoid Arthritis (RA), you will have good flexibility in the body only by the late morning . The intent is for you to learn the practices and thereafter practice on your own lifelong for better health and mobility and to alleviate pain.

"}]

data.title: Hatha Yoga Abhyasa @11AM
data.description:
[{"title":"Hatha Yoga ","description":"

Welcome to our yoga class, where we embark on a holistic journey towards well-being and self-discovery. Our sessions are designed to cater to individuals of all levels, from beginners to those seeking intermediate challenges.

Here's what you can expect:

1. Sun/Moon Salutations and Sukshma Vyayama:

We commence our practice with energizing Sun/Moon Salutations and diverse styles of Sukshma Vyayama each day. Sukshma Vyayama involves subtle warm-up exercises to prepare your body for the upcoming session.


2. Asanas:

Progress from beginner to intermediate-level asanas, including Vinyasa flows and Ashtanga series.
Concentrated stretches precede specific asanas, ensuring enhanced comfort and noticeable improvements within the same session.

3. Pranayama:

Learn pranayama techniques tailored for addressing various breathing problems and promoting overall well-being.
Dedicated sessions focusing on pranayama for half an hour on specific days.

4. Meditation and Deep Relaxation:

Experience the profound benefits of meditation, with extended sessions on designated days.
The class concludes with deep relaxation or meditation for a peaceful state of mind.


5. Student Engagement:

Students are encouraged to pay close attention to their practice, fostering mindfulness and self-awareness.
Instructors provide personalized adjustments to enhance the effectiveness of each pose.


6. Varied Sequences:

Every day brings a fresh and unique sequence to keep the practice engaging and diverse.


7. Outcome:

  • Results vary individually and depend on dedication.
  • Expect improvements in body flexibility, enhanced calmness, heightened concentration, and potential reversal of health issues through the activation of acupressure points.
  • Our instructors also offer suggestions for maintaining a healthy lifestyle.
  • In our yoga class, we believe that dedication is key to unlocking the full spectrum of benefits. Join us on this transformative journey towards a healthier and more balanced life.
"}]

data.description:
[{"title":"Yogo to prepare for Birth","description":"

A 55 to 60 minutes session designed for pregnant women in their 12 to 40 weeks of pregnancy. The class is designed with asanas to strengthen the legs, hips, back and pelvic floor, to improve the flexibility of the pelvic girdle & to make space for the womb. Includes kegels, restorative, meditative practices along with pranayama and breathwork for labour. The practice also aims to easen the discomforts of the pregnancy (back pain, sleeplessness, stress, breathlessness, sciatica, edema, mood swings etc).

"}]

teacher.description: I am a yoga practitioner turned yoga teacher, currently passionate about making Prenatal Yoga available/ accessible to as many pregnant women as possible.  As a former cult.fit trainer, I believe I have had the opportunity to teach Yoga to a varied crowd and has helped me find my true passion in making yoga available to all. I fell in love with prenatal yoga during my own pregnancy journey and have been teaching ever since. This has helped me really understand what pregnancy means to a woman and  how yoga can help her embrace the physiological, psychological and emotional changes in her.  I am grateful for the prenatal journey I could embark on during my pregnancy and I think no woman should miss out on experiencing this.  This is what motivates me to teach Prenatal Yoga.

teacher.description:
Ruta's journey as a shloka teacher began with a deep passion for preserving and passing on the rich cultural heritage of India. Her dedication to this art form is evident in her comprehensive knowledge of Sanskrit, impeccable pronunciation, and a deep understanding of the meanings and nuances of the shlokas. Her teaching methodology is known for its meticulous attention to detail and her ability to make the often complex and archaic language accessible to learners of all levels.

Ruta has made significant contributions to the preservation and promotion of India's spiritual and literary traditions. She has conducted numerous workshops, seminars, and online classes, attracting students and enthusiasts from across the globe. Her warm and engaging teaching style, combined with her vast knowledge, has made her a sought-after guru for those looking to delve into the world of shlokas.

teacher.description:
Ruta's journey as a shloka teacher began with a deep passion for preserving and passing on the rich cultural heritage of India. Her dedication to this art form is evident in her comprehensive knowledge of Sanskrit, impeccable pronunciation, and a deep understanding of the meanings and nuances of the shlokas. Her teaching methodology is known for its meticulous attention to detail and her ability to make the often complex and archaic language accessible to learners of all levels.

Ruta has made significant contributions to the preservation and promotion of India's spiritual and literary traditions. She has conducted numerous workshops, seminars, and online classes, attracting students and enthusiasts from across the globe. Her warm and engaging teaching style, combined with her vast knowledge, has made her a sought-after guru for those looking to delve into the world of shlokas.

data.title: Hatha yoga abhyasa @7PM
data.description:
[{"title":"Hatha yoga abhyasa @7PM ","description":"

Welcome to our yoga class, where we embark on a holistic journey towards well-being and self-discovery. Our sessions are designed to cater to individuals of all levels, from beginners to those seeking intermediate challenges.

Here's what you can expect:

1. Sun/Moon Salutations and Sukshma Vyayama:

We commence our practice with energizing Sun/Moon Salutations and diverse styles of Sukshma Vyayama each day. Sukshma Vyayama involves subtle warm-up exercises to prepare your body for the upcoming session.


2. Asanas:

Progress from beginner to intermediate-level asanas, including Vinyasa flows and Ashtanga series.
Concentrated stretches precede specific asanas, ensuring enhanced comfort and noticeable improvements within the same session.

3. Pranayama:

Learn pranayama techniques tailored for addressing various breathing problems and promoting overall well-being.
Dedicated sessions focusing on pranayama for half an hour on specific days.

4. Meditation and Deep Relaxation:

Experience the profound benefits of meditation, with extended sessions on designated days.
The class concludes with deep relaxation or meditation for a peaceful state of mind.


5. Student Engagement:

Students are encouraged to pay close attention to their practice, fostering mindfulness and self-awareness.
Instructors provide personalized adjustments to enhance the effectiveness of each pose.


6. Varied Sequences:

Every day brings a fresh and unique sequence to keep the practice engaging and diverse.


7. Outcome:

  • Results vary individually and depend on dedication.
  • Expect improvements in body flexibility, enhanced calmness, heightened concentration, and potential reversal of health issues through the activation of acupressure points.
  • Our instructors also offer suggestions for maintaining a healthy lifestyle.
  • In our yoga class, we believe that dedication is key to unlocking the full spectrum of benefits.
  • Join us on this transformative journey towards a healthier and more balanced life.
"}]

data.title: Yoga for changing lifestyle
data.description:
[{"title":"","description":"

Monthly Yoga Course by SAM Yoga Labs

Overview of the Course:

Welcome to SAM Yoga labs, a transformative monthly yoga journey designed to bring back the lost you. Throughout this program, we will delve into the essence of Hatha & Ashtanga Yoga, empowering participants to delve deep into their conscience. Whether you are a beginner seeking a holistic introduction to yoga or an experienced practitioner looking to deepen your practice, this course offers a balanced and enriching experience.

Who is This Course For?

Ideal for Beginners: Perfect for those new to yoga, providing a solid foundation and understanding of fundamental practices.

Intermediate Practitioners: Suitable for individuals with some yoga experience, offering opportunities to refine techniques and deepen awareness.

Advanced Students: Tailored to challenge and expand the practice of seasoned yogis, exploring advanced postures and nuanced aspects of yoga.

Typical Class Plan:

Opening and Centering (10 minutes): Begin each session with centering techniques and mindfulness practices.

Warm-Up and Breathwork (10 minutes): Energize the body with dynamic movements and pranayama exercises.

Main Practice (25 minutes): Explore a variety of yoga poses, sequences, and themes, adapting to different levels of expertise.

Cool-Down and Relaxation (10 minutes): Wind down with gentle stretches, restorative poses, and guided relaxation.

Closing Reflection (5 minutes): Share insights, ask questions, and set intentions for personal practice.

What are the Course Outcomes?

Upon completion of a month session with SAM Yoga Labs, participants can expect to:

Cultivate Flexibility: Enhance physical flexibility and mobility through a well-rounded yoga practice.

Stress Reduction: Develop mindfulness and relaxation skills to manage stress and foster a calm mind.

Strength and Balance: Build core strength, improve balance, and promote overall physical well-being.

Mind-Body Connection: Deepen the connection between mind and body, fostering a holistic approach to health.

teacher.description:
Ruta's journey as a shloka teacher began with a deep passion for preserving and passing on the rich cultural heritage of India. Her dedication to this art form is evident in her comprehensive knowledge of Sanskrit, impeccable pronunciation, and a deep understanding of the meanings and nuances of the shlokas. Her teaching methodology is known for its meticulous attention to detail and her ability to make the often complex and archaic language accessible to learners of all levels.

Ruta has made significant contributions to the preservation and promotion of India's spiritual and literary traditions. She has conducted numerous workshops, seminars, and online classes, attracting students and enthusiasts from across the globe. Her warm and engaging teaching style, combined with her vast knowledge, has made her a sought-after guru for those looking to delve into the world of shlokas.
